SEARCH
Package tradedatacorp.smelter.lexical.binary

Class BinaryTools

java.lang.Object
tradedatacorp.smelter.lexical.binary.BinaryTools
public class BinaryTools extends Object
A utility class providing stateless static methods for converting between binary representations (arrays or collections) and integers. This class will not check for any invalid input nor exceptions. User is fully responsible for ensuring valid arguments are passed into each function.

  • Field Details

    • LOG10_BASE2

      public static final double LOG10_BASE2

  • Method Details

    • getMinimumNumberOfBits

      public static int getMinimumNumberOfBits(int nonNegativeInteger)
      Calculates the minimum number of bits required to represent a non-negative base-10 integer in binary.
      Parameters:
      nonNegativeInteger - a non-negative integer to be evaluated.
      Returns:
      The minimum number of bits to represent the non-negative integer. NOTE: If nonNegativeInteger is negative, it's binary representation will be treated as positive and still bitshift accordingly.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: getMinimumNumberOfBits(3); // returns 2. binary 11 => 3, minimum of 2 bits represents 3.
 Example 2: getMinimumNumberOfBits(5); // returns 3. binary 101 => 5, minimum of 3 bits represents 5.
 Example 3: getMinimumNumberOfBits(0); // returns 1. binary 0 => 0, minimum of 1 bit represents 0.

    • toUnsignedInt

      public static int toUnsignedInt(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a non-negative base-10 integer from an array of boolean values.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element. Most significant bit is at index 0.
      Returns:
      The non-negative base-10 integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: toUnsignedInt(new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns 7. bool array represents 111
 Example 2: toUnsignedInt(new boolean[]{true, true, false}); //returns 6. bool array represents 110

    • to2sCompInt

      public static int to2sCompInt(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a base-10 integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns -1. bool array represents 111
 Example 2: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{false, true, true,true}); //returns 7. bool array represents 0111
 Example 3: to2sCompInt(new boolean[]{true, true, false}); //returns -2. bool array represents 110

    • toUnsignedLong

      public static long toUnsignedLong(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 non-negative long integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement binary number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a non-negative long base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element. Most significant bit is at index 0.
      Returns:
      The base-10 long integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: toUnsignedLong(new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns 7L. bool array represents 111
 Example 2: toUnsignedLong(new boolean[]{true, true, false}); //returns 6L. bool array represents 110

    • to2sCompLong

      public static long to2sCompLong(boolean[] bin)
      Calculates a base-10 long integer from an array of boolean values that represent 2s complement binary number.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array to be evaluated that represents a base-10 integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns -1L. bool array represents 111
 Example 2: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{false, true, true,true}); //returns 7L. bool array represents 0111
 Example 3: to2sCompLong(new boolean[]{true, true, false}); //returns -2L. bool array represents 110

    • toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset

      public static int toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(boolean[] bin, int startIndex, int length)
      Calculates a base-10 integer from boolean array subset.
      Parameters:
      bin - A boolean array. Does not represent any particular type of format. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      startIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset to be used for the calculation.
      length - The total number of consecutive elements to be used in bin.
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 1, 3); //returns 2. subset array: 010, indices 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 2: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 1, 4); //returns 5. subset array: 0101, indices 1, 2, 3, and 4.
 Example 3: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 0, 4); //returns 10. subset array: 1010, indices 0, 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 4: toUnsignedIntFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 2, 3); //returns 5. subset array: 101, indices 2, 3, and 4

    • toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset

      public static long toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(boolean[] bin, int startIndex, int length)
      Calculates a base-10 long integer from boolean array subset.
      Parameters:
      bin - A boolean array. Does not represent any particular type of format. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      startIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset to be used for the calculation.
      length - The total number of consecutive elements to be used in bin..
      Returns:
      The base-10 integer to be calculated.

      Examples:

      
 boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 1, 3); //returns 2L. subset array: 010, indices 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 2: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 1, 4); //returns 5L. subset array: 0101, indices 1, 2, 3, and 4.
 Example 3: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 0, 4); //returns 10L. subset array: 1010, indices 0, 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 4: toUnsignedLongFromBoolSubset(exampleBoolArray, 2, 3); //returns 5L. subset array: 101, indices 2, 3, and 4

    • isEqualBoolArray

      public static boolean isEqualBoolArray(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays are equivalent
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      bin2 - A boolean array. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays have the same length and every element in bin1 is equal to the corresponding element in bin2; false otherwise.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{true, false}); //returns true.
 Example 2: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{false, true}); //returns false.
 Example 3: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{false, true, true}); //returns false.
 Example 4: isEqualBoolArray(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns false.

    • isEqualUnsignedIntValue

      public static boolean isEqualUnsignedIntValue(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays representing non-negative binary numbers are equivalent in value.
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array representing a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      bin2 - A boolean array representing a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays evaluate to the same unsigned integer in bin1; false otherwise.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{true, false}); //returns true. 2 == 2
 Example 2: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{false, true}); //returns false. 2 != 1
 Example 3: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{false, true, true}); //returns true. 3 == 3
 Example 4: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns false. 3 != -7

    • isEqual2sCompIntValue

      public static boolean isEqual2sCompIntValue(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays of a 2s complement binary number are equivalent in value.
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array representing an integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      bin2 - A boolean array representing an integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays evaluate to the same 2s complement integer in bin1; false otherwise.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{true, false}); //returns true. -2 == -2
 Example 2: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{false, true}); //returns false.  -2 != 1
 Example 3: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{false, true, true}); //returns false. -1 != 3
 Example 4: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns true. -1 == -1

    • isEqualUnsignedLongValue

      public static boolean isEqualUnsignedLongValue(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays representing non-negative binary numbers are equivalent in value.
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array representing a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      bin2 - A boolean array representing a non-negative base-10 integer. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays evaluate to the same unsigned integer in bin1; false otherwise.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{true, false}); //returns true. 2L == 2L
 Example 2: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{false, true}); //returns false. 2L != 1L
 Example 3: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{false, true, true}); //returns true. 3L == 3L
 Example 4: isEqualUnsignedIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns false. 3L != -7L

    • isEqual2sCompLongValue

      public static boolean isEqual2sCompLongValue(boolean[] bin1, boolean[] bin2)
      Determines if two boolean arrays of a 2s complement binary number are equivalent in value.
      Parameters:
      bin1 - A boolean array representing an integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      bin2 - A boolean array representing an integer in 2s complement notation. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      true if both arrays evaluate to the same 2s complement integer in bin1; false otherwise.

      Examples:

      
 Example 1: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{true, false}); //returns true. -2L == -2L
 Example 2: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, false},new boolean[]{false, true}); //returns false.  -2L != 1L
 Example 3: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{false, true, true}); //returns false. -1L != 3L
 Example 4: isEqual2sCompIntValue(new boolean[]{true, true},new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns true. -1L == -1L

    • genClone

      public static boolean[] genClone(boolean[] originalBin)
      Clones a new instance of a boolean array.
      Parameters:
      originalBin - The boolean array to be cloned. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that is equivalent to originalBin.

      Example:

      isEqualBoolArray(originalBin, genClone(originalBin)); //Evaluates to true originalBin != genClone(originalBin); //Evaluates to false

    • genSubset

      public static boolean[] genSubset(int inclusiveStartIndex, int subsetLength, boolean[] bin)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array that is a subset of another boolean array.
      Parameters:
      inclusiveStartIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset. This is the starting index of bin
      subsetLength - The total number of consecutive elements to be used in bin. Also, the length of the return value
      bin - The array the return value will generate a subset from. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that is a subset of bin.

      Examples:

      
 boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: genSubset(1,3,exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true, false} //index 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 2: genSubset(1,4,exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true, false, true} //index 1, 2, 3, and 4.
 Example 3: genSubset(0,4,exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false, true, false} //index 0, 1, 3, and 3.
 Example 4: genSubset(2,3,exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false, true} //index 2, 3, and 4.

    • genSubsetFromIndexes

      public static boolean[] genSubsetFromIndexes(int inclusiveStartIndex, int inclusiveEndIndex, boolean[] bin)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array that is a subset of another boolean array.
      Parameters:
      inclusiveStartIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset. This is the starting index of bin
      inclusiveEndIndex - The index of the least significant bit in the subset. This is the starting index of bin
      bin - The array the return value will generate a subset from. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that is a subset of bin. Then length of array is inclusiveStartIndex - inclusiveEndIndex + 1.

      Example:

      exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true,false,true,false,true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: genSubsetFromIndexes(1, 3, exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true, false} //index 1, 2, and 3.
 Example 2: genSubsetFromIndexes(1, 4, exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true, false, true} //index 1, 2, 3, and 4.
 Example 3: genSubsetFromIndexes(0, 4, exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false, true, false, true} //The entire original array.
 Example 4: genSubsetFromIndexes(2, 3, exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false} //index 2 and 3.

    • genLeftSubset

      public static boolean[] genLeftSubset(int exclusiveRightIndex, boolean[] bin)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array that is a left subset of another boolean array. The most significant bit as at index 0.
      Parameters:
      exclusiveRightIndex - The index immediately after the last element to include in the subset. Must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to the length of bin.
      bin - The array the return value will generate a subset from. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that is a subset of bin. Then length of array is exclusiveRightIndex.

      Example:

       boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true, false, true, false, true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: genLeftSubset(1, exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false} //indices 0 and 1
 Example 2: genLeftSubset(3, exampleBoolArray); //returns {true, false, true} //indices 0, 1, and 2
 Example 3: genLeftSubset(5, exampleBoolArray); //returns the equivalent bin array (indices 0 - 4)

    • genRightSubset

      public static boolean[] genRightSubset(int inclusiveLeftIndex, boolean[] bin)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array that is a left subset of another boolean array. The least significant bit as at index bin.length - 1.
      Parameters:
      inclusiveLeftIndex - The index of the most significant bit in the subset. This is the starting index of bin
      bin - The array the return value will generate a subset from. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that is a subset of bin.

      Example:

      
 boolean exampleBoolArray = new boolean[]{true, false, true, false, true}; //10101 rep
 Example 1: genRightSubset(1, exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true, false, true} //indices 1, 2, 3, and 4
 Example 2: genRightSubset(3, exampleBoolArray); //returns {false, true} //indices 3 and 4
 Example 3: genRightSubset(0, 5, exampleBoolArray); //returns the equivalent bin array (indices 0 - 4)

    • genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt

      public static boolean[] genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(int val, int bitSize)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array representing an unsigned integer.
      Parameters:
      val - The value to be represented by the return boolean array. Must be non-negative.
      bitSize - The length of the boolean array.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that represents the unsigned val where most significant bit is at index 0. This will return an incorrect value if bitSize is too small for val.

      Example:

      
 Example 1: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(7, 3); //returns {true, true, true}} binary: 111
 Example 2: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(7, 4); //returns {false, true, true, true}} binary: 0111
 Example 3: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(5, 3); //returns {true, false, true}} binary: 101
 Example 4: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(0, 5); //returns {false, false, false, false, false}} binary: 00000

    • genUnsignedIntToMinimumBoolArray

      public static boolean[] genUnsignedIntToMinimumBoolArray(int value)
      Generates a new instance of a boolean array that represents an unsigned integer. The size of the array is the smallest possible size needed to represent the integer.
      Parameters:
      value - The value that the boolean array will represent. Must be a non-negative value.
      Returns:
      A boolean array that represents value.

    • genBoolArrayFromUnsignedLong

      public static boolean[] genBoolArrayFromUnsignedLong(long val, int bitSize)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array representing an unsigned integer.
      Parameters:
      val - The value to be represented by the return boolean array. Must be non-negative.
      bitSize - The length of the boolean array.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that represents the unsigned val where most significant bit is at index 0. This will return an incorrect value if bitSize is too small for val.

      Example:

       
 Example 1: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(7L,3); //returns {true,true,true}} binary: 111
 Example 2: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(7L,4); //returns {false,true,true,true}} binary: 0111
 Example 3: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(5L,3); //returns {true,false,true}} binary: 101
 Example 4: genBoolArrayFromUnsignedInt(0L,5); //returns {false,false,false,false,false}} binary: 00000

    • gen2sCompNegate

      public static boolean[] gen2sCompNegate(boolean[] bin)
      Returns a new instance of a boolean array represents the negation of an existing array.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array that represents a base-10 integer in 2s complement notation. This will be negated. Must be non-null and contain at least 1 element.
      Returns:
      New boolean array that represents the 2s complement negation of bin.

      Example:

      
 Example 1: gen2sCompNegate(new boolean[]{true, true, true}); //returns {false, false, true} from bin: 111 = -1 to bin: 001 = 1
 Example 2: gen2sCompNegate(new boolean[]{true, true, false, false}); //returns {false, true, false, false} from bin: 1100 = -4 to bin: 0100 = 4

    • setSubsetUnsignedInt

      public static void setSubsetUnsignedInt(int inclusiveStartIndex, int bitLength, int value, boolean[] bin)
      This mutates a specific subset of an array to a value that represents an unsigned base-10 value.
      Parameters:
      inclusiveStartIndex - The index of the most significant bit in bin that will be mutated.
      bitLength - The length of the subset that will be mutated.
      value - The unsigned value that will be converted to the boolean array subset.
      bin - The instance that will be mutated.

      Example:

      
 Example 1:
 setSubsetUnsignedInt(
   1, //Starting at index 1.
   3, //Length 3, manipulate indices: 1, 2, and 3.
   7, // unsigned 7 evaulates to boolean 111 == {true, true, true}.
   new boolean[]{true, false, true, false, true}, //bin: 10101 index values 1, 2, and 3 will be overridden to true, true, and true respectively.
 ); //modified value of bin: {true, true, true, true, true}.
 
 Example 2:
 setSubsetUnsignedInt(
   1, //Starting at index 1.
   3, //Length 3, manipulate indices: 1, 2, and 3.
   1, // unsigned 1 evaulates to boolean 001 == {false, false, true}.
   new boolean[]{false, false, false, false, false}, //bin: 00000 index values 1, 2, and 3 will be overridden to false, false, and true respectively.
 ); //modified value of bin: {false, false, false, true, false}.

    • setSubsetUnsignedLong

      public static void setSubsetUnsignedLong(int inclusiveStartIndex, int bitLength, long value, boolean[] bin)
      This mutates a specific subset of an array to a value that represents an unsigned base-10 value.
      Parameters:
      inclusiveStartIndex - The index of the most significant bit in bin that will be mutated.
      bitLength - The length of the subset that will be mutated.
      value - The unsigned value that will be converted to the boolean array subset.
      bin - The instance that will be mutated.

      Example:

      
 Example 1:
 setSubsetUnsignedLong(
   1, //Starting at index 1.
   3, //Length 3, manipulate indices: 1, 2, and 3.
   7L, // unsigned 7 evaulates to boolean 111 == {true, true, true}.
   new boolean[]{true, false, true, false, true}, //bin: 10101 index values 1, 2, and 3 will be overridden to true, true, and true respectively.
 ); //modified value of bin: {true, true, true, true, true}.
 
 Example 2:
 setSubsetUnsignedLong(
   1, //Starting at index 1.
   3, //Length 3, manipulate indices: 1, 2, and 3.
   1L, // unsigned 1 evaulates to boolean 001 == {false, false, true}.
   new boolean[]{false, false, false, false, false}, //bin: 00000 index values 1, 2, and 3 will be overridden to false, false, and true respectively.
 ); //modified value of bin: {false, false, false, true, false}.

    • setUnsignedIntToBoolArray

      public static void setUnsignedIntToBoolArray(int value, boolean[] bin)
      Mutates a boolean array to represent a given non-negative integer.
      Parameters:
      value - The value that mutated bin will represent upon completion.
      bin - The boolean array that will be mutated to represent an unsigned boolean number. The most significant bit is at index 0. The value will not be correct if the size of bin is not large enough to represent the value.

      Example:

      
 Example 1: setUnsignedIntToBoolArray(7, new boolean[3]); sets the bin to {true, true, true}: 7 == binary 111
 Example 2: setUnsignedIntToBoolArray(7, new boolean[5]); sets the bin to {false, false, true, true, true}: 7 == binary 00111

    • setUnsignedLongToBoolArray

      public static void setUnsignedLongToBoolArray(long value, boolean[] bin)
      Mutates a boolean array to represent a given non-negative integer.
      Parameters:
      value - The value that mutated bin will represent upon completion.
      bin - The boolean array that will be mutated to represent an unsigned boolean number. The most significant bit is at index 0. The value will not be correct if the size of bin is not large enough to represent the value.

      Example:

      
 Example 1: setUnsignedLongToBoolArray(7L, new boolean[3]); sets the bin to {true, true, true}: 7 == binary 111
 Example 2: setUnsignedLongToBoolArray(7L, new boolean[5]); sets the bin to {false, false, true, true, true}: 7 == binary 00111

    • set2sCompNegate

      public static void set2sCompNegate(boolean[] bin)
      Mutates a boolean array representing a 2's complement integer to its negative value.
      Parameters:
      bin - The boolean array that will be mutated to represent its negated value.

      Example:

      
 boolean[] bin1 = new boolean[]{true, true, true}; //binary 111 == -1
 boolean[] bin2 = new boolean[]{false, false, true}; //binary 001 == 1
 boolean[] bin3 = new boolean[]{false, true, false, true}; //binary 0101 == 5
 boolean[] bin4 = new boolean[]{true, false, true, true}; //binary 1011 == -5
 boolean[] bin5 = new boolean[]{false, false}; //binary 00 == 0
 Example 1: set2sCompNegate(bin1); sets from 111 to 001. sets from -1 to 1
 Example 2: set2sCompNegate(bin2); sets from 001 to 111. sets from 1 to -1
 Example 3: set2sCompNegate(bin3); sets from 0101 to 1011. sets from 5 to -5
 Example 4: set2sCompNegate(bin4); sets from 1011 to 0101. sets from -5 to 5
 Example 5: set2sCompNegate(bin5); sets from 00 to 00. sets from 0 to 0

    • genConcatenatedBoolArrays

      public static boolean[] genConcatenatedBoolArrays(boolean[]... binArrays)
      Generates a new boolean array by concatenating several different arrays into a singular array.
      Parameters:
      binArrays - A collection of boolean arrays that will be merged in order from left to right or index 0 to binArrays.length.
      Returns:
      The concatenation of all arrays in binArrays..

      Example:

      
 Example 1: genConcatenatedBoolArrays(new boolean[]{true, true}, new boolean[]{false, false}); //returns new boolean[]{true, true, false, false};
 Example 2: 
 boolean[][] bin2 = new boolean[3][];
 bin2[0] = new boolean[]{true, true};
 bin2[1] = new boolean[]{false, false};
 bin2[2] = new boolean[]{true, false};
 genConcatenatedBoolArrays(bin2); //returns new boolean[]{true, true, false, false, true, false};

    • genConcatenatedBoolArrays

      public static boolean[] genConcatenatedBoolArrays(boolean[][]... bin3DArray)
      Generates a new boolean array by concatenating several different 2D boolean arrays into a single 1D array.
      Parameters:
      bin3DArray - A collection of 2D boolean arrays that will be merged in order from left to right and top to bottom.
      Returns:
      A new boolean array containing all elements from bin3DArray in order.

      Example:

      
 boolean[][][] bin3DArray = {
     { {true, true}, {false} },
     { {false, true}, {true, false} }
 };

 boolean[] result = genConcatenatedBoolArrays(bin3DArray);
 // result = {true, true, false, false, true, true, false}

    • genBoolArrayFrom8BitCharString

      public static boolean[] genBoolArrayFrom8BitCharString(String asciiString)
      Generates a boolean array instance of a string where each 8 booleans represent the ASCII character. The resulting array has a length equal to 8 times the number of characters in asciiString.
      Parameters:
      asciiString - The string that will be used to generate the boolean array to be returned.
      Returns:
      The boolean array that represents the asciiString. Example: genBoolArrayFrom8BitCharString("AB"); //A is 65 == binary: 0100 0001, B is 66 == binary: 0100 0010 Returns new boolean[]{ false, true, false,false, false, false, false, true, //char A false, true, false,false, false, false, true, false, //char B };

    • genStringFrom8BitBoolCharRep

      public static String genStringFrom8BitBoolCharRep(boolean[] EightBitCharBool)
      Returns a String by converting every 8 bits into an integer that represents an ascii character.
      Parameters:
      EightBitCharBool - The boolean array that represents a string to be returned.
      Returns:
      String represented by EightBitCharBool. Ignores any remaining bits if their count is not a multiple of 8.

      Example:

      
 binAB = new boolean[]{
   false, true, false,false, false, false, false, true, //char A
   false, true, false,false, false, false, true, false, //char B
 };
 Example 1: genStringFrom8BitBoolCharRep(binAB); //returns "AB";
 
 binAB_more = new boolean[]{
   false, true, false,false, false, false, false, true, //char A
   false, true, false,false, false, false, true, false, //char B
   true, false, true //Characters that will be ignored.
 };
 Example 2: genStringFrom8BitBoolCharRep(binAB_more); //returns "AB";
